title: Justice Department Finds Texas Juvenile Justice Department Violated Children's Constitution Rights
text:
Five Texas Juvenile Justice Centers were found by the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) to be violating the U.S. Constitution in its treatment of detained minors.
In a lengthy
report on the Texas Juvenile Justice Department (TJJD), the DOJ found the TJJD infringed upon children‚Äôs constitutional rights in five locations across Texas as well as violated the Individuals with Disabilities Act (IDEA), and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).

title: Vicky Kaushal shows wife Katrina Kaif's childhood pic as his phone wallpaper; Baby arriving soon?
text:
Post their destination wedding, the couple's life has clearly changed for good, with both Katrina and Vicky embracing each other's families, cultures, and lifestyles. That being said, the two never shy away from talking about each other and sharing some interesting deets from their marital life.
Doing it once again, Vicky Kaushal recently made a cute display of affection for his wife by revealing his adorable phone wallpaper.
During his recent engagement with GQ India, Vicky was seen showing off his phone's wallpaper, which featured a childhood picture of his wife Katrina Kaif. Fans were clearly left excited and elated witnessing their adorable bonding. Vicky, who started by speaking about the things that he can't live without accidentally picked up his phone and showed it off to the camera, thus revealing his wife's cute photo.
"Your day starts with this and ends with this, and yeah, it's always with you. We're just living in times where you can't think of life without a phone," the actor. In the picture, a younger Katrina Kaif can be seen smiling her heart out with two cute ponytails.
As soon as the picture went viral, fans were seen sharing the same widely across social media handles. Some even quipped whether the couple is planning to make family plans anytime soon.
While many fans loved Vicky's cute gesture for wife Katrina Kaif, many couldn't stop wondering if the couple is planning to extend their family. Earlier, reports of Katrina Kaif being pregnant made rounds every time the actress stepped out. The news comes in the wake of many star couples announcing parenthood, the latest being Deepika and Ranveer.
Vicky Kaushal Work Front
Last seen in Meghna Gulzar's Sam Bahadur , Vicky received a lot of appreciation for his performance as India's first Field Marshall Sam Manekshaw. Besides that, he also had an impactful role in Rajkumar Hirani's Dunki and had his own share of praise for his character.
The actor will soon commence work on Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Love and War , where he will share the screen with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

author: JASON CHLAPEK | TELEGRAM STAFF
title: Temple police officer turns drone hobby into on-duty job, program
text: Matt Wittman dreamed of being a pilot. The 16-year Temple Police Department veteran fulfilled that dream a few years ago. He doesn‚Äôt even leave the ground when performing his pilot duties. Wittman is a certified drone pilot. He has helped Temple Police start a drone program. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always had an interest in flying,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúMy goal in life was to be a pilot and I wanted to go to pilot school, but I realized that it was too expensive. The next best thing was to fly things through remote control.‚Äù Wittman, a father of three, said he always wanted a remote control helicopter. He received a drone for Christmas one year that had a short life before he received a drone with more quality. ‚ÄúI finally convinced some ‚Äòhigher-ups‚Äô in the household to get me a drone for Fathers Day, and I‚Äôve been flying it ever since,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúI love being able to see things from the sky.‚Äù Wittman said he has flown drones since 2019. He has a YouTube channel called Machine Gun Droner. The link to his YouTube channel is [http://www.youtube.com/](http://www.youtube.com/)@machinegundroner9411. Shortly after Wittman started this channel, Temple Police took interest. ‚ÄúI personally didn‚Äôt have to convince the department to start using drones,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúIn the process of getting this program started, they finally realized that I had a YouTube channel for flying drones, so they wanted me to start flying them for the PD.‚Äù Eventually, flying drones evolved into a position, Wittman said. It was also decided Temple Police needed more than just one drone pilot within the department. ‚ÄúI put together a training protocol to train more drone pilots,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúIn my first class, we had 10 people spread across the Temple Police and Fire & Rescue departments. It was a lot of fun.‚Äù Wittman said there are 10 certified drone pilots in the Temple Police Department. Temple Fire & Rescue has two certified drone pilots. Wittman said drones have plenty of benefits in police work. ‚ÄúWe get closer to dangerous situations without endangering the officers,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúIt also makes us reach a lot of places in quicker amounts of time for search and rescue situations. Instead of spending hours walking the trails, we put the drone up and get a bird‚Äôs eye view.‚Äù Wittman believes drones help save lives. He does not condone the use of drones as weapons. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in the business of saving lives. The last thing we want to do is take lives,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt agree with using drones as weapons in any way, form or fashion.‚Äù Drones are commonly known as unmanned aerial vehicles. However, Wittman said the term can apply to any vehicle that is unmanned and remote-control operated. Wittman believes drones will help revolutionize law enforcement. He mentioned that some police forces, such as the Arlington, Burlington, N.C., and Fremont, Calif., police departments, already use drones as emergency responders. Another example of drones being used in police work is the Bee Cave Police Department, southwest of Austin. Bee Cave Police have AV8 drones across their jurisdiction that wait for orders to dispatch to a scene. ‚ÄúIf you get a 911 call for shots fired or a disturbance or something of that nature, they‚Äôll send a drone out to that location to scout the area,‚Äù Wittman said. ‚ÄúBy doing that, it can either prevent officers from going into a dangerous situation or it can say there‚Äôs nothing there and no need to send anybody there.‚Äù

title: Huge wave lashes California shores, evacuation warnings issued after many left injured : Watch
text:
A big swell generated over the Pacific Ocean pushing toward shorelines caused coastal flooding and prompted evacuation alerts.
On Thursday, huge waves lashed the shores of California leaving eight people injured according to KETY-TV.
A big swell generated over the Pacific Ocean pushing toward shorelines caused coastal flooding and prompted evacuation alerts.
In Ventura, a bystander video showed a rogue wave slam into a seawall, sending a crowd of onlookers fleeing inland in panic as the water rushed toward them.
Evacuation warnings were issued in coastal Marin County on Thursday morning and Capitola Village later in the day.
In a flash bulletin, the National Weather Service said that the waves could range from 28 to 33 feet, and up to 40 feet in some locations, adding that there were reports of flooding in low-lying coastal areas.
Forecasters urged people to stay off rocks and jetties, and to not turn their backs to the ocean because of the danger of ‚Äòsneaker waves‚Äô ‚Äì occasional much bigger waves that can run far up the sand and wash someone off a beach.
Conditions could get worse into the weekend as the storm system moves in from the Pacific, particularly in southern California, where San Diego is expected to see the highest surf on Saturday.
Los Angeles as well in under high surf and coastal flooding advisories until 10 pm on Saturday.
‚ÄòEveryone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure,‚Äô urged the NWS.
Additionally, in Aptos on the north end of Monterey Bay, surf overran the beach on Thursday and swept into a parking lot, leaving the area strewn with debris.
‚ÄòMother Nature‚Äôs angry,‚Äô said Eve Krammer, an Aptos resident for several years. ‚ÄòI mean these waves are gnarly. They‚Äôre huge.‚Äô
‚ÄòI feel for the people that are down low here,‚Äô added Jeff Howard, another Aptod resident.

title: Religious Tourism: Retail brands flocking to religious cities with rise in spiritual tourism, ET TravelWorld
text: Representative image.Brands are aggressively expanding to religious cities as growing tourism is attracting retail brands to establish a footprint in these potential market. Cities like Ayodhya, Ajmer, Katra, Somnath, Shirdi, Mathura, Bodh Gaya, and Madurai have seen entry of brands such as Blackberrys, Manyavar, Spykar, Decathlon and Fab India among others. According to CBRE, retail brands across segments, including fashion & apparel, food & beverage, hypermarkets, homeware & department stores and consumer electronics brands, are expanding by tailoring the offerings to the pilgrim‚Äôs needs. ‚ÄúGovernment initiatives to promote tourism and improve connectivity between pilgrimage sites are further boosting this growth. The rise of online retail platforms offering easy access to faith-based products and services is also a key factor,‚Äù said Anshuman Magazine, Chairman & CEO - India, South-East Asia, Middle East & Africa, CBRE. This trend reflects a broader shift in tourist preferences, with travelers seeking transformative experiences beyond traditional rituals. The rise of urban spiritual tourism is catering to this desire, attracting visitors to cities known for their deep religious and spiritual significance. The report identifies Amritsar, Ajmer, Varanasi, Katra, Somnath, Shirdi, Ayodhya, Puri, Tirupati, Mathura, Dwarka, Bodh Gaya, Guruvayur, and Madurai as key cities witnessing this retail boom. Retail brands are strategically adapting their offerings in both established mall clusters and high-street locations to cater to the growing tourist population.The surge in spiritual tourism can be attributed to enhanced infrastructure, including well-connected roads, airports, and public transportation, as well as the development of various accommodation options such as hotels, guesthouses, and wellness centres. To meet the growing demand for spiritual travel, local governments and businesses are joining forces to create unique retail experiences.Major hotel chains are also adapting to the evolving preferences of spiritual tourists, offering clean, hygienic, and family-friendly accommodations that command premium pricing. Several cities have a strong pipeline of new hotel projects, with well-known brands like Marriott, Taj, and Hyatt showing keen interest in entering this market. From live performances to traditional bazaars, food and beverage vendors, and more, participants can immerse themselves in the essence of Ramadan in Bahrain.See More DetailsIn India, a partnership has developed between wellness centres and hospitality brands to serve the needs of spiritual tourism. Wellness centers offer services like yoga and Ayurveda to enhance physical, mental, and spiritual health. ‚ÄúDriven by the growing popularity of spiritual tourism, investors are flocking to capitalise on the market's potential. This trend has created opportunities for the hospitality and retail sectors to thrive in these destinations,‚Äù said Ram Chandnani, Managing Director, Advisory & Transaction Services, CBRE India.
